page.title: 13LUCTON NEAR AYMESTREY
page.content: Lucton village lies about 2 mls SW of Aymestrey and is a popular residential area. It contains 2 farms one of 40 acres and the other 220 and some 30 dwellings which includes 4 council houses and 5 holiday cottages. Although there is no social centre, only one bus a week on Friday (market day in Leominster) no school or shop the residents enjoy their seclusion. In the centre of the village is a church, originally medieval, rebuilt in Victorian times and now converted into a private dwelling which still retains a church-like exterior. Nearby is the former{Lucton School}a private school founded in 1711. The original lovely{Queen Anne}building still stands facing the main road. The school was forced to close suddenly in 1984 due to lack of pupils and consequent financial difficulties.
